episodes.title: Leaving Jehovah's witnesses is so painful (Monday morning thoughts) ... Read the description
episodes.description:
I forgot to share this in the video:

When talking with some friends about what this pain is like, I thought of the analogy of needing to have a limb amputated. Of course, no one ever wants to willingly remove a limb, but if that limb somehow becomes damage, injured, infected beyond recovery - if keeping that limb threatens your well-being or ability to carry on a normal sustainable life - unfortunately, you know the wisest course is to surrender the limb. 
Even after doing so, you will have "false pain" where that limb once was. You'll have memories of what life was like when you had the limb. Good & bad. Perhaps you'll wonder if you made the wrong decision & 'maybe if you just waited longer the limb could've gotten better, or you could've learned to live with it despite the struggle you would have had for the rest of your life.'
But then you think of how healthy you are now, everything you're still able to do & even things you were never able to do before that you have strength to do now... Maybe you have a high-performing prosthetic & most people don't even notice there's anything abnormal about you unless you tell them.. 

This is what it's like to lose loved ones to the org of JWs .. It's painful & we will miss them & memories will continue to resurface, but we can become stronger & healthier & happier despite the loss. ❤

episodes.title: Is disfellowshipping by Jehovah's witnesses supported by Scripture?
episodes.description:
"IS DISFELLOWSHIPPING BY JEHOVAH'S WITNESSES SUPPORTED BY SCRIPTURE?"

Topic covered by so many others.. Im drawing from much of their insightful research & critical reasoning
Try not to repeat exactly their words, follow my own sequence of thoughts:
FUNDAMENTALS
• What is the message of the bible 
• 2 Tim 3:16 ; Rom 15:4 
https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/2007167#h=6:0-8:498
https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/1001061102#h=3:0-3:355
• What was God's purpose in providing his people with Laws 10 CMMDMTS 
Love & justice in ancient Israel in February 2019 study article (part 1 of 4) 
Jehovah knows that we long for love and yearn for justice. (Ps. 33:5) We can be sure that our God loves us dearly and wants us to be treated fairly. This becomes evident when we look closely at the Law that Jehovah gave to the nation of Israel through Moses. If you have a heart starved for affection or a spirit crushed by injustice, please consider how the Mosaic Law* reveals Jehovah’s concern for his people.

May 2019 study edition resumes this series
Love & justice in the Christian Cong part 2 of 4 studied week of July 1-7  -grieving widow, prostitute at Simon house Pharisees..

https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/2019404
https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/1200002694#h=24-26

• Contrast Jesus and Pharisees 4 PHOTOS -JESUS & PHARISEES
https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/2001923#h=8-21 (paragraph 5-16 & 21)
Works https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/pc/r1/lp-e/1200274432/21/0
• Mercy forgiveness faith righteousness 
Prodigal son https://wol.jw.org/en/wol/d/r1/lp-e/1997640#h=11:0-12:327
Example of sister... Father was removed as an elder about 10 years ago when my younger sister started coming back to meetings after being d.f'd for 7+years & he hugged her at the kingdom hall during the c.o. visit (while she was a long way off to verbalize or demonstrate repentant attitude)
He WAS an elder for 25 years! 

Other scriptures: 
1 Corinthians 5:9-13 ... Certainly with respect to these verses, the congregation would about association if you continued to attend or tried to draw away other members with yourself. They wouldn't welcome anyone calling themselves a "bro or sis" in Cong.. But this makes no mention of family relations being cut off indefinitely )
2 Corinthians 2:5-10 .... Verse 6 "the majority, not all, especially not family"
1 Thes 4  ... Not going beyond limits, minding your own business
2 john 7,10 11  anti Christ
Matt 18:15-17 .. Sin against you as tax collector, sinner (with whom Jesus himself was frequently reported to have meals with)

Regarding those who renounce beliefs they were taught, those who may be labeled as apostate, mentally corrupt or diseased - there's all different types of people who deviate from faith or belief, different reasons - good & bad... Main point: imitate Jesus.... If asked: who is ultimate apostate? Satan the Devil.. How did Jesus treat him? Shun, ignore, avoid contact?
Matt 4... He was "led by Satan into the wilderness"
Lengthy discussion exchanging thoughts on quoted holy writings.

episodes.title: Exit Letter to Jehovah's Witness Parents (... that they will probably never read)
episodes.description:
It took me a long time to decide whether I wanted to publicly share this with everyone.  But, in my search for letters from others who are going through this same process, I didn't find any that I could directly relate to although many that I derived encouragement from.

You'll notice that a lot of the programming is still ingrained.. Such as saying "I am one of Jehovah witnesses", instead of "I was..

Correction: I said 4 siblings, I have 5. 3 blood-related & 2 adopted. 3 nieces & 1 nephew.. 

I hope that someone will benefit from hearing my words & how I've processed my thoughts. Many will be able to sympathize with the dilemma of navigating the strong love & attachments to your family amidst the new directions our lives have taken.

All photos used in this video were taken by me.
In addition to being PIMO, I have an avid appreciation for all things "nature": sunsets, trees, flowers, birds, water, rainbows.  I hope you enjoy them!

I welcome any and all comments. Specifically those of support & encouragement. I'm also willing to share encouragement to those needing it, to the best of my ability. 

Please comment, share & subscribe (the more who subscribe avail me of the ability to share encouraging & interesting videos that I find interesting & relatable)... 

new.cq.2019@gmail.com ✌
